name: Gorrell Tank Car Park
notes: Main car park, approx 200 spaces, £1.50/hr, max 8 hours. Fills early on sunny weekends.

name: Cromwell Road Car Park
notes: Approx 80 spaces, £1.50/hr, max 8 hours. Good alternative when Gorrell is full.

name: Middle Wall Car Park
notes: Near harbour, approx 60 spaces, £1.50/hr, max 4 hours only.

name: Tower Parade Car Park
notes: Tankerton end, approx 50 spaces, £1.50/hr. Good for slopes and castle.

name: Borstal Hill Car Park
notes: Free parking, 2 hour maximum. 10 min walk to centre.

name: Harbour Public Toilets
notes: Free, open 8am-6pm (later in summer). Accessible facilities available.

name: Tankerton Slopes Toilets
notes: Free, open 8am-6pm. Near Beach Walk Cafe.

name: High Street Public Toilets
notes: Near Gorrell Tank car park. Free, open 8am-5pm.

name: West Beach Steps
notes: Steps down to West Beach. Can be slippery when wet.

name: Harbour Beach Access
notes: Sloped access near Old Neptune. Wheelchair accessible to promenade.

name: Tankerton Slopes Access
notes: Gentle slope down from the slopes to beach. Best for pushchairs.

name: The Street Access
notes: Access point for The Street shingle spit. Check tide times before walking out!

name: NatWest ATM (Co-op)
notes: Inside Co-op, free withdrawals. Available during store hours.

name: Lloyds Bank ATM
notes: External ATM, free withdrawals, 24 hours.

name: Post Office ATM
notes: Inside Post Office, free withdrawals. Limited hours.

name: Whitstable Railway Station
notes: Southeastern trains to London Victoria (90 mins), Canterbury, and coast. Step-free access.

name: High Street Bus Stop (towards Canterbury)
notes: Stagecoach services to Canterbury, Herne Bay. Regular service.

name: High Street Bus Stop (towards Herne Bay)
notes: Stagecoach services along coast to Herne Bay.

name: Tankerton Bus Stop
notes: Tower Parade, for Tankerton area services.

name: Whitstable Lifeboat Station
notes: RNLI volunteer station. Inshore lifeboat. In emergency call 999 Coastguard.

name: Whitstable Harbour
notes: Historic working harbour. Fish market, restaurants, boat trips.

name: The Old Neptune Pub
notes: The famous pub on the beach. Great for sunset drinks.

name: The Street
notes: Natural shingle spit visible at low tide. Check tide times before walking out!

name: Tankerton Slopes
notes: Grassy slopes above beach. Great for picnics and sunsets.

name: Whitstable Castle
notes: Victorian Gothic house with gardens. Free to visit grounds.

name: Harbour Bike Racks
notes: Covered bike racks near the harbour. Free.

name: High Street Bike Racks
notes: Near Oxford Street junction. Free, uncovered.

name: Crab & Winkle Way (Start)
notes: Cycle/walking path to Canterbury (7 miles). Follows old railway line.

name: Harbour Water Fountain
notes: Refill your water bottle here. Free.

name: Tankerton Slopes Water Fountain
notes: Near the toilets. Free refills.
